sentence.text: p21-activated kinase 4 (positive regulation of angiogenesis) has been shown to regulate many cellular processes in cancer cells, including migration, polarization and proliferation.
However, the role of positive regulation of angiogenesis in neuroblastoma remains unclear.
In the present study, we demonstrated that positive regulation of angiogenesis was overexpressed in neuroblastoma tissues and was correlated with tumor malignance and prognosis.
To investigate the function of positive regulation of angiogenesis in neuroblastoma, we used a small-molecule inhibitor that targets PAK4, that is, PF-3758309.

In conclusion, the present study demonstrated, for the first time, the expression and function of positive regulation of angiogenesis in neuroblastomas and the inhibitory effect of PF-3758309, which deserves further investigation as an alternative strategy for neuroblastoma treatment
